column5: A want to be fisherman I saw the other day insists that Sauger are bigger than Walleye at the same age.....I told him that the only time a Sauger is bigger is when he weighs more and that never happens at the same age as a Walleye !!!!....WHOS RIGHT?????

There are some unstated variables in your question. Things like water temperature, availability of food, etc. can have an effect but, all else being equal, a walleye will be bigger and heavier than a sauger of the same age. derrek."It's the weaseling out of things that sets us apart from the animals.... Except the weasel." - H.J. Simpson
....except when the sauger lives next to the wastewater discharge pipe of a nuclear power plant.
Well, he'd have three eyes and would glow, but would he be bigger?derrek."It's the weaseling out of things that sets us apart from the animals.... Except the weasel." - H.J. Simpson
